sentences: Mõistad sa seda? (Do you understand this?)
Ta mõistab matemaatikat headasti. (He understands math very well.)
Kas teie lapsed mõistavad eesti keelt? (Do your children understand Estonian?)
context: The word 'mõistad' is the 2nd person singular present tense form of the Estonian verb 'mõista', which means 'to understand'. It specifically addresses one person informally (you singular). The verb indicates comprehension, grasping a concept, or realizing something. This word belongs to the same word family as the adjective 'arukas' (intelligent/smart), suggesting that understanding is connected to intelligence or having good sense.
